item.title: i use Arch, btw
item.description: Yesterday my Pop OS install got borked and instead of fixing it, since I’m bored at home and self-quarantined anyway, decided to try installing Arch Linux. First time, and how hard could it be anyway? Got it done finally, and learned a lot along the way. Here are some notes to speed it up next time. Boot into my Windows partition, download the Arch ISO, use Rufus to make a bootable drive, and boot into Arch.
